Hello there,

I've just joined the REST Discuss group and I have several qu=
estions that I've still not found and answer for.

One of these is about hi=
erarchical relationships (many belong to one) in a RESTfull API.

For insta=
nce if there are two kinds of resources, articles and comments, with the fo=
llowing URLs:

GET /articles - lists the articles
GET /articles/:ID - shows=
 one specific article

GET /comment/:ID - gives back one comment

what is t=
he right way to have an API list the comments that belong to one of the art=
icles.

One option I thought of would be to have something like:

GET /arti=
cles/:ID/comments 

But this doesn't feel quite right and it doesn't seem t=
o scale if the nesting is more than one level deep.

What are your thoughts=
 on this?

Constantin Tovisi
